ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: minotaur horn change?
ygData.msgSnippet: Arrrggggghhhhhhhh THE CLIENT already does something similiar to this with the Trade switch (Everyone, Party, No Trades). THE CLIENT can decided whither or not
ygData.messageBody:
Arrrggggghhhhhhhh

THE CLIENT already does something similiar to this with the Trade switch
(Everyone, Party, No Trades).

THE CLIENT can decided whither or not to send the command to SERVER. THE
CLIENT can control the whole process.

Rokenn



> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
> Sent: Friday, June 02, 2000 1:14 PM
> To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: minotaur horn change?
>
>
> Nope. They have to check that area to see that it isn't over
> another player
> or npc for example or it becomes a give, not a drop. Now if
> they made the
> flag No Drop/No give, maybe it would work, but otherwise I
> would imagine it
> is more complicated than you are presenting. Just like on
> the boats you
> cannot drop or give objects away. Both things are eliminated
> not just one
> so likely they are interconnected. Once you get that cursor
> over a moving
> environment there is a lot more going on than just a simple
> button action.
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: beatdropbattledrum@...
> [mailto:beatdropbattledrum@...]
> Sent: Friday, June 02, 2000 2:14 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Re: minotaur horn change?
>
>
> Button or not, it is still a computation of a mouse click. You click
> destroy button item gets destroyed. You click an area item gets
> dropped. I still think that it is just as simple as the destroy
> thing.
>
> --- In eqbards@egroups.com, "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@d...> wrote:
> > Because the destroy action is connected to a button where as
> dropping an
> > item occurs in the visible area of the screen. There isn't a clear
> trigger
> > for the option like there is for destroy. Maybe it isn't a big
> deal, but I
> > suspect that if it wasn't they would have done it already given the
> numerous
> > bugs with containers, lore items, lore containers, etc. poofing
> whep dropped
> > accidentally.
> >
> > Kit
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Kevin L. Crawford [mailto:Lyrnia@h...]
> > Sent: Friday, June 02, 2000 2:06 PM
> > To: eqbards@egroups.com
> > Subject: Re: [eqbards] minotaur horn change?
> >
> >
> > Uhh your options would only affect you, not others. Why would you
> not give
> > that option to players on PVP servers? your private settings on
> your pc
> > don't affect other players. It's a personal setting, just like the
> 'prompt
> > on destroy' option we already have.
> >
> > **tries to figure out why this is such a difficult concept to
> grasp**
> >
> > Lyrnia Jongleur
> > The Baffled Bard
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@d...>
> > To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> > Sent: Friday, June 02, 2000 3:11 PM
> > Subject: RE: [eqbards] minotaur horn change?
> >
> >
> > > with no drop option unavailable on pvp servers I assume?
> > >
> > > Kit
> > >
> > > Just say NO to pop-up boxes :)
> > >
> > > If they implement this the way it should go is: Drop, Confirm, No
> Drop.
> > > If set to Drop everything behaves the way it does now.
> > > If set to Confirm you get the annoying confirmation box.
> > > If set to No Drop your items act as No Drop items.
> > >
> > >
